0x1305400.alarm.name: Abnormal SFTP Service For SDRs
0x1305400.alarm.advice:
Step1 Locate the device where the alarm is generated according to alarm details.
Step2 Use the floating IP address of the management plane to log in to the management node as user dfvmanager using PuTTY. Run the ssh dfvmanager@Storage plane IP address of the device generating the alarm command to jump to the device.
Step3 Run the su - root command to switch to user root. You can run the TMOUT=0 command to disable the automatic disconnection function.
Step4 Use PuTTY to log in to the device using the management IP address. Run the show billing-sdr-config command to check whether the current configuration is correct.
4.1 If yes=>[Step6].
4.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step5 If the key authentication mode is used, run the change billing-sdr-pkfileinfo command to modify the configuration. If the password authentication mode is used, run the change billing-sdr-logininfo command to modify the configuration. Wait 10 minutes, and then check whether the alarm is cleared.
5.1 If yes, no further action is required.
5.2 If no=>[Step6].
Step6 Exit the CLI and use the SFTP tool to check whether the SFTP server can be connected.
6.1 If yes=>[Step8].
6.2 If no=>[Step7].
Step7 Configure the network correctly and ensure that the network between the cluster and the SDR server is normal. Wait 10 minutes and check whether the alarm is cleared.
7.1 If yes, no further action is required.
7.2 If no=>[Step8].
Step8 Contact technical support engineers.

0xE17710009.alarm.name: Abnormal Connection Between A Node And The Pulsar Service
0xE17710009.alarm.advice:
Step1 Use the floating IP address of the management plane to log in to the management node as user dfvmanager using PuTTY. Run the ssh dfvmanager@storage plane IP address command to switch to the device where the alarm is generated.
Step2 Run the su - root command to switch to user root. You can run the TMOUT=0 command to prevent automatic system disconnection.
Step3 Run the sudo -u oam service_cli_start -u admin command, enter the password of user admin as prompted, and press Enter to log in to the CLI.
Step4 Check whether the Pulsar address is correctly configured: Run the show pulsarinfo command to check whether the IP address and port in the URL are correctly configured.
4.1 If yes=>[Step6].
4.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step5 Configure the Pulsar address: Run the change pulsarinfo command and check whether the alarm is cleared one minute later.
5.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
5.2 If no=>[Step6].
Step6 Check whether the Athenz authentication information is correctly configured: Run the show pulsar_athenzinfo command to check whether the authentication information is correctly configured.
6.1 If yes=>[Step8].
6.2 If no=>[Step7].
Step7 Configure the Athenz authentication information: Run the change pulsar_athenzinfo command and check whether the alarm is cleared 1 minute later.
7.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
7.2 If no=>[Step8].
Step8 Run the command to ping the Pulsar address obtained in [Step4] to check whether the network connection between the node where the alarm is generated and the Pulsar service is normal. Check whether the command output is in the following format:
PING 10.200.100.217 (10.200.100.217) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 10.200.100.217: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=0.035 ms
64 bytes from 10.200.100.217: icmp_seq=2 ttl=64 time=0.028 ms
64 bytes from 10.200.100.217: icmp_seq=3 ttl=64 time=0.025 ms
8.1 If yes=>[Step11].
8.2 If no=>[Step10].
Step9 Run the command to ping the ZTS address obtained in [Step6] to check whether the network connection between the node where the alarm is generated and the Pulsar service is normal. Check whether the command output is in the following format:
PING 10.200.100.217 (10.200.100.217) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 10.200.100.217: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=0.035 ms
64 bytes from 10.200.100.217: icmp_seq=2 ttl=64 time=0.028 ms
64 bytes from 10.200.100.217: icmp_seq=3 ttl=64 time=0.025 ms
9.1 If yes=>[Step11].
9.2 If no=>[Step10].
Step10 Correctly configure the network. Ensure that the network between the device and Pulsar service is normal. Wait 1 minute and then check whether the alarm is cleared.
10.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
10.2 If no=>[Step11].
Step11 Contact technical support engineers.
0xE17710009.alarm.desc: The connection between a node (storage plane IP address:[HostIp]) and the Pulsar service is abnormal.
0xE17710009.alarm.desc.detail: The connection between a node (storage plane IP address:[HostIp]) and the Pulsar service is abnormal.
0xE17710009.alarm.effect: When the communication between the node and the Pulsar service is abnormal, the device message cannot be pushed to the customer.

0x100FEA620034.alarm.name: FSM Resources Are Abnormal
0x100FEA620034.alarm.effect:
1.The portal service is unavailable.
2.Related HA services are affected.
3.O&M services are unavailable.
4.Related HA services are affected.
5.Capacity expansion and reduction services are affected.
6.The Network Time Protocol (NTP) service is unavailable.
7.Monitoring data aggregation is affected.
8.Database functions are affected.
9.Data monitoring services are affected.
10.Installation, capacity expansion, and reduction services are affected.
11.The Tomcat cannot monitor the web server of the FSM, and northbound interfaces are affected.
12.Upgrade services are affected.
13.All alarm-related functions are unavailable.
14.This resource implements the portal authentication and user management functions. If it is abnormal, the portal service is unavailable.
15.This resource implements machine-machine account authentication. If it is abnormal, all services on the FSM node are unavailable.
16.Check the gateway functions. If a gateway fault occurs, the network may be interrupted or the active/standby switchover may fail.

0x1001EA610001.alarm.name: A BBU Disk Is Sub-healthy
0x1001EA610001.alarm.advice:
Step1 Replace the faulty BBU disk based on the chapter about replacing the M.2 SSD in the product documentation. Wait 10 minutes and check whether the alarm is cleared.
1.1 If yes=>no further action is required.

0x100FEA630021.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether an alarm is generated on DeviceManager indicating that the communication of the node where data backup fails is abnormal.
1.1 If yes, handle the problem based on the alarm information.
1.2 If no=>[Step2].
Step2 Check whether an alarm is generated on DeviceManager indicating that the available disk space on the FSM node or on the node where data backup fails is insufficient.
2.1 If yes, handle the problem based on the alarm information.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Contact technical support engineers.

0xFEA620113.alarm.name: The ZooKeeper Cluster Is Faulty
0xFEA620113.alarm.advice:
Step1 On the alarm management page, check whether network exception alarms are generated. If yes, clear the alarms by referring to the related alarm handling procedures, and then check whether the alarm is cleared.
1.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
1.2 If no=>[Step2].
Step2 On the alarm management page, check whether alarm Insufficient Disk Partition Space exists. If yes, clear the alarm by referring to the related alarm handling procedures, and then check whether the alarm is cleared.
2.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 On the alarm management page, check whether alarm The ZooKeeper Process Is Abnormal exists. If yes, clear the alarm by referring to the related alarm handling procedures, and then check whether the alarm is cleared.
3.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
3.2 If no=>[Step4].
Step4 Contact technical support engineers.
0xFEA620113.alarm.effect: The Metadata Controller (MDC) module cannot provide services, such as data reconstruction or migration, or capacity expansion or reduction. In this case, if a disk or a server is faulty, storage service I/Os may fail and data loss may occur.

Step1 Log in to the FSM node, update the primary key, and synchronize the key to the FSA node.
Step2 If the alarm persists, contact technical support engineers.

Step2 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.

0xE1771001E.alarm.name: The Client Failed To Verify The Server Certificate
0xE1771001E.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check the alarm information.
1.1 If the alarm information shows that the peer service certificate has expired=>[Step2].
1.2 If the alarm information shows that the peer service certificate is untrusted=>[Step4].
1.3 If the alarm information does not show whether the peer service certificate has expired or is untrusted=>[Step5].
Step2 If the peer certificate expires, contact the peer service personnel of the corresponding service to update the certificate. Then check whether the alarm is cleared.
2.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the alarm information shows that the peer service certificate is untrusted.
3.1 If yes=>[Step4].
3.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step4 Obtain the peer CA certificate of the corresponding service and import the certificate to the current system. Check whether this alarm is cleared.
4.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
4.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step5 Contact technical support engineers.

0xE1771001E.alarm.desc.detail: The certificate fails to be verified when node (device IP address: [HostIp]) connects to server (server address: [serverAddress], [serverName]).
0xE1771001E.alarm.effect: If the system as a client fails to verify the server certificate when using HTTPS to communicate with a server, the HTTPS communication may be insecure.

0xF3C01001E.alarm.name: Invalid HyperMetro Pair
0xF3C01001E.alarm.advice:
Step1 On DeviceManager, choose Data Protection > HyperMetro > HyperMetro Pair to view the HyperMetro pairs whose running status is Invalid. Alternatively, run the following command on the CLI to view the invalid HyperMetro pairs: show hyper_metro_pair_batch general location=0 replicationClusterId=0 count=40|filterRow column=Running\sStatus predict=equal_to value=INVALID.
Step2 Locally delete the invalid HyperMetro pairs on the two ends and create them again.
2.1 If the alarm persists or the operation fails=>[Step3].
2.2 If the operation is successful and the alarm is cleared, no further action is required.
Step3 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.

0xFEA630009.alarm.name: The CM Process Is Abnormal
0xFEA630009.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether the network connection of the storage node where the abnormal process resides is normal. Run the ping command on the faulty node and other nodes where the control cluster is deployed. Ensure that the storage network is normal and no packet loss or packet error occurs.
1.1 If yes=>[Step2].
1.2 If no, contact the network administrator to rectify the network fault. If the alarm persists=>[Step2].
Step2 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.

0xF00DD0001.alarm.name: The Remote Replication Consistency Group Is Interrupted
0xF00DD0001.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether alarms are generated for the storage pools where primary and secondary volumes of a member pair of the remote replication consistency group resides.
1.1 If yes, clear the alarm by taking recommended actions. If the alarm persists=>[Step2].
1.2 If no=>[Step2].
Step2 Check whether alarms are generated for primary and secondary volumes of a member pair of the remote replication consistency group.
2.1 If yes, handle the alarms by taking recommended actions. If the alarm persists=>[Step3].
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the network devices between the replication devices are properly connected.
3.1 If the cables are not properly connected, replace the cables of the faulty link to ensure that the link connection is stable. If the alarm persists=>[3.2].
3.2 If the intermediate network is faulty (for example, the firewall port configuration is incorrect, the switch VLAN configuration is incorrect, or the router is faulty), rectify the fault. If the alarm persists=>[Step4].
3.3 If network devices are properly connected=>[Step4].
Step4 Check whether the capacity of primary and secondary volumes of a member pair of the remote replication consistency group is the same.
4.1 If yes=>[Step5].
4.2 If no, the capacity of one end has been expanded. In this case, expand the capacity of the volume at the other end and then start the synchronization.
Step5 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.

0xF00DD0001.alarm.desc.detail: The remote replication consistency group is interrupted.
0xF00DD0001.alarm.effect: The data of a pair in the consistency group cannot be backed up.

1.2 If no=>[Step2].

2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Contact technical support engineers.

0xE1771000A.alarm.name: The Current TLS Version Has Security Risks
0xE1771000A.alarm.advice:
Clear the alarm:
Step1 Use the floating IP address of the management plane to log in to the management page as the administrator.
Step2 Choose Settings > Object Service Settings > Security Settings > TLS Policy.
Step3 Deselect TLS1.1 Policy and click the Save button. Check whether the alarm is cleared.
3.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
3.2 If no=>[Step4].
Step4 Contact technical support engineers.

Mask the alarm:
Step1 Use the floating IP address of the management plane to log in to the management page as the administrator.
Step2 Choose Settings > System Settings > Alarm Masking.
Step3 Select this alarm and click Mask Alarm.
0xE1771000A.alarm.desc: TLS 1.1 is enabled for component (component name: [ComponentName]), which has security risks. You are advised to use TLS 1.2.
0xE1771000A.alarm.desc.detail: TLS 1.1 is enabled for component (component name: [ComponentName]), which has security risks. You are advised to use TLS 1.2.

0xF3C040009.alarm.name: Invalid HyperMetro Consistency Group
0xF3C040009.alarm.advice:
Step1 On DeviceManager, choose Data Protection > HyperMetro > HyperMetro Consistency Group to view the HyperMetro consistency groups whose running status is Invalid. Alternatively, run the following command on the CLI to view the invalid HyperMetro consistency groups: show hyper_metro_consistency_group_batch general location=0 count=40 replicationClusterId=0|filterRow column=Running\sStatus predict=equal_to value=INVALID.
Step2 Locally delete the invalid HyperMetro consistency groups on the two ends and create them again.
2.1 If the alarm persists or the operation fails=>[Step3].
2.2 If the operation is successful and the alarm is cleared, no further action is required.
Step3 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.
0xF3C040009.alarm.effect: You can only delete the HyperMetro consistency group and remove its members. No other operations can be performed on it.

0xF00D80129.alarm.name: The Storage Pool Is Faulty
0xF00D80129.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether the disk is removed.
1.1 If yes, insert the removed disk. If the alarm persists=>[Step2].
1.2 If no=>[Step2].
Step2 Check whether the disk is faulty.
2.1 If yes=>[Step5].
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the server is powered off.
3.1 If yes, power on the server. If the alarm persists=>[Step4].
3.2 If no=>[Step4].
Step4 On the alarm management page, check whether alarms related to network exceptions are generated.
4.1 If yes, clear the alarms by referring to the related alarm handling procedures. If the alarms persist=>[Step5].
4.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step5 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.
0xF00D80129.alarm.effect:
1. Data may be lost.
2. Storage services may be interrupted.
0xF000A0138.alarm.name: Insufficient Disk Space
0xF000A0138.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether multiple faulty disks exist on the current node.
1.1 If yes=>[Step2].
1.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step2 Replace faulty disks and check whether the alarm is cleared.
2.1 If yes, no further action is required.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the number of disks on the current node is less than that on other nodes.
3.1 If yes=>[Step4].
3.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step4 Add more disks to the current node according to the related manual and check whether the alarm is cleared.
4.1 If yes, no further action is required.
4.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step5 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.
0xF000A0138.alarm.desc: The space of disk (node IP [node_ip], slot ID [slot_id], SN [esn_id]) is insufficient.
0xF000A0138.alarm.desc.detail: The space of disk (node IP [node_ip], slot ID [slot_id], SN [esn_id]) is insufficient.
0xF000A0138.alarm.effect: If the free space of a disk is insufficient and the storage space is not expanded in a timely manner, or the faulty disk on the current node is not replaced, service access may be abnormal.

0xFC3670003.alarm.name: GaussDB HA Heartbeat Interruption Between Management Nodes
0xFC3670003.alarm.advice:
Step1 Run the ping command to check whether the active and standby management nodes that provide the OAM-U service can be pinged. If the network is abnormal, contact the system administrator to rectify the network fault.
Step2 If the network is normal, check whether the alarm is cleared.
2.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the active or standby management node is reset or powered off.
3.1 If yes=>[Step4].
3.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step4 If the node is in the reset state, wait until the reset is complete. If the node is powered off, power it on.
After the active or standby management node is started, check whether the alarm is cleared.
4.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
4.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step5 Contact technical support.

0xFC3670003.alarm.effect: The reliability of the OAM-U GaussDB service is reduced.

2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the active or standby management node is reset or powered off.
3.1 If yes=>[Step4].
3.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step4 If the node is in the reset state, wait until the reset is complete. If the node is powered off, power it on.
After the active or standby management node is started, check whether the alarm is cleared.
4.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
4.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step5 Contact technical support.

0xE17710011.alarm.name: 50 Percentage Of Nodes In The AZ Reach The Isolation Standard
0xE17710011.alarm.advice:
Step1 Use the management plane floating IP address to log in to the management node via PuTTY. Contact the network administrator to obtain the storage plane IP address and use the ping command to check if the IP address is reachable.
1.1 If yes=>[Step3].
1.2 If no=>[Step2].
Step2 Contact the network administrator to restore the connection between the faulty node and back-end network. Wait for 10 minutes and check whether the alarm is automatically cleared.
2.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Contact technical support engineers.

0x200F00310065.alarm.name: Failed To Test The Email Server
0x200F00310065.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether the IP address, port number, user name, and password of the email server are correct.
1.1 If no, correct the server configurations=>[Step2].
1.2 If yes=>[Step2].
Step2 Check whether the certificate of the email server is valid.
2.1 If no, import the valid certificate=>[Step3].
2.2 If yes=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the network between the array and the email server is reachable.
3.1 If no, repair the network between the array and the server=>[Step4].
3.2 If yes=>[Step4].
Step4 Check whether the email server is running properly.
4.1 If no, repair the email server=>[Step5].
4.2 If yes=>[Step5].
Step5 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.

0xF00710007.alarm.name: The Two-Factor Authentication Email Server Is Unavailable
0xF00710007.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether the server address is correctly configured.
1.1 If no, correct the configuration. If the alarm persists=>[Step2].
1.2 If yes=>[Step2].
Step2 Check whether the network connection between the controller and the server is normal.
2.1 If no, recover the network connection. Wait for 5 minutes. If the alarm persists=>[Step3].
2.2 If yes=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the user name and password for logging in to the server are correctly configured.
3.1 If no, correct the configurations. If the alarm persists=>[Step4].
3.2 If yes=>[Step4].
Step4 Check whether the server certificate is valid.
4.1 If no, import the valid certificate=>[Step5].
4.2 If yes=>[Step5].
Step5 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.

0xF00710007.alarm.effect: Two-factor authentication emails cannot be sent successfully.
0xF00710007.alarm.argument.explain:
1. [server]: Server type
2. [reason]: Alarm cause
3. [error-code]: Error code

0x200F00710087.alarm.name: Failed To Test The SMTP Server For Receiving Two-Factor Authentication Information
0x200F00710087.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether the IP address, port number, user name, and password of the email server are correct.
1.1 If no, configure them correctly and=>[Step2].
1.2 If yes=>[Step2].
Step2 Check whether the email server certificate is valid.
2.1 If no, import a valid certificate and go to [Step3].
2.2 If yes=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the network between the storage array and email server is reachable.
3.1 If no, repair the network and go to [Step4].
3.2 If yes=>[Step4].
Step4 Check whether the email server is running properly.
4.1 If no, restore the email and go to [Step5].
4.2 If yes=>[Step5].
Step5 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.

0xE17710019.alarm.name: 80 Percentage Of Nodes In The AZ Reach The Isolation Standard
0xE17710019.alarm.advice:
Step1 Use the floating IP address of the management plane to log in to the management node via PuTTY. Contact the network administrator to obtain the storage plane IP address and use the ping command to check if the IP address is reachable.
1.1 If yes=>[Step3].
1.2 If no=>[Step2].
Step2 Contact the network administrator to restore the connection between the faulty node and back-end network. Wait for 10 minutes and check whether the alarm is automatically cleared.
2.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Contact technical support engineers.

0xE17710019.alarm.effect: A large number of nodes reach the isolation standard. As a result, services are unavailable.

Step1 Check whether alarm Heartbeat Communication Between the Active and Standby FSM Nodes Interrupted or Insufficient Disk Partition Space exists.
1.1 If yes, clear the alarm by referring to the handling suggestions.
1.2 If no=>[Step2].
Step2 Log in to the primary FSM node and manually synchronize files.
Step3 Check whether the alarm is cleared.
3.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
3.2 If no=>[Step4].
Step4 Contact technical support engineers.
0xFEA62340D.alarm.desc: Data synchronization between the primary and secondary FSM nodes is abnormal.
0xFEA62340D.alarm.desc.detail: Data synchronization between the primary and secondary FSM nodes is abnormal.
0xFEA62340D.alarm.effect: Management data on the primary and secondary FSM nodes is inconsistent. After the primary/secondary switchover, some management data may be lost. Before this alarm is cleared, do not power off or perform primary/secondary switchover on the primary FSM node. Otherwise, services may be interrupted or management data may be lost.
0x100F40420001.alarm.name: SSL Verification Is Disabled

Step2 Check whether the alarm is automatically cleared.
2.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Contact technical support engineers.
0x100F40420001.alarm.effect: If the SSL verification on the FSM or FSA node is disabled, the SSL certificate used for the communication between FSM and FSA is not verified, which may cause security risks.

Step2 Check whether the proxy server is correctly configured.
2.1 If no, reconfigure the proxy server.
2.2 If yes=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the DNS service is configured.
3.1 If no, configure the DNS service.
3.2 If yes=>[Step4].
Step4 Re-authenticate the Call Home service.
Step5 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.

0xEE0090004.alarm.name: The Iowait CPU Usage Of A Single Core Is Too High
0xEE0090004.alarm.advice:
Step1 On the alarm management page, check whether the "PlogServer In Suboptimal State" alarm exists on the node where this alarm is generated.
1.1 If yes=>[Step2].
1.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step2 Wait half an hour and check whether the alarm is cleared.
2.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Contact technical support engineers.

0x1E0090002.alarm.name: The RAID Controller Card Of The Device Is Faulty
0x1E0090002.alarm.advice:
Step1 Locate the device based on the rack ID and enclosure ID provided in alarm details.
Note: Data on an offline node can only be reconstructed manually.
Step2 Possible cause: The RAID controller card is not detected.
2.1 Check whether the RAID controller card can be detected.
If yes=>[Step3].
If no=>[2.2].
2.2 Install a RAID controller card.
Caution: This operation is a high-risk operation. Before this operation, contact technical support engineers.
2.3 Power on the device, and check whether the alarm is cleared.
If yes=>no further action is required.
If no=>[Step4].
Step3 Possible cause: The RAID controller card is faulty.
3.1 Replace the RAID controller card.
Caution: This operation is a high-risk operation. Before this operation, contact technical support engineers.
3.2 Power on the device, and check whether the alarm is cleared.
If yes=>no further action is required.
If no=>[Step4].
Step4 Contact technical support engineers.
0x1E0090002.alarm.desc: The RAID controller card of device ([dev-name]) is faulty.
0x1E0090002.alarm.desc.detail: The RAID controller card of device ([dev-name]) is faulty.
0x1EA670002.alarm.name: The Memory Status Is Abnormal
0x1EA670002.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether the ambient temperature is too high.
1.1 If yes, reduce the ambient temperature, and check whether the alarm is cleared.
1.1.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
1.1.2 If no=>[Step2].
1.2 If no=>[Step2].
Step2 Check whether the ventilation holes of the device are blocked.
2.1 If yes, clear the blockage, and check whether the alarm is cleared.
2.1.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
2.1.2 If no=>[Step3].
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Check whether the fans of the device are faulty.
3.1 If yes, replace the fans, and check whether the alarm is cleared.

0xF000A0136.alarm.name: The Disk Temperature Is Abnormal
0xF000A0136.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether the heat dissipation system in the equipment room and fans in the subrack are running properly.
1.1 If the fans are abnormal=>[Step3].
1.2 If the heat dissipation system is abnormal=>[Step2].
1.3 If both the heat dissipation system in the equipment room and fans in the subrack are running properly=>[Step4].
Step2 Contact the equipment room administrator to rectify the fault, and check whether the alarm is cleared.
2.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Replace the components of the fans in the subrack based on the related manual. Wait 5 minutes and check whether the alarm is cleared.
3.1 If yes=>no further action is required.
3.2 If no=>[Step4].
Step4 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.
0xF000A0136.alarm.desc: The temperature of disk (node IP address [node_ip], slot ID [slot_id], SN [esn_id]) is abnormal.
0xF000A0136.alarm.desc.detail: The temperature of disk (node IP address [node_ip], slot ID [slot_id], SN [esn_id]) is abnormal.
0xF000A0136.alarm.effect:
1. If the disk is used as the main storage, the system migrates data on the disk and then removes the disk from the storage pool. A decreasing number of disks reduces the storage space, and performance deteriorates.
2. If the disk is used as cache, the system migrates data on the main storage disk corresponding to the abnormal cache disk, and then removes the main storage disk from the storage pool. A decreasing number of disks reduces the storage space, and performance deteriorates. If the server has only one cache disk and the temperature of the disk is abnormal, the system migrates data on the server and removes the server from the storage pool.

0x1001EA631003.alarm.name: Abnormal Rep Process Of The DR Service
0x1001EA631003.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether you can log in to the node where the process is abnormal.
1.1 If yes=>[Step2].
1.2 If no=>[Step4].
Step2 Check whether the available memory on the faulty node is greater than 14 GB.
2.1 If yes=>[Step3].
2.2 If no, increase the memory and try again.
Step3 Check whether the /opt/dsware/service/dr/dms/config/dms.cfg and /opt/dsware/service/dr/dms/bin/rep files exist on the faulty node.
3.1 If yes=>[Step4].
3.2 If no, copy the same files from a properly running node to the faulty node and try again.
Step4 Check whether the alarm is generated for the cluster indicating that the CM service on the HyperMetro control node is abnormal or the HyperMetro CM process is abnormal.
4.1 If yes, handle the alarm by taking recommended actions. After the operation is complete, check whether the alarm is cleared.
4.1.1 If yes, no further action is required.
4.1.2 If no=>[Step5].
4.2 If no=>[Step5].
Step5 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.
0x1001EA631003.alarm.desc: The rep process of the DR service is abnormal.
0x1001EA631003.alarm.desc.detail: The rep process of the DR service is abnormal.
0x1001EA631003.alarm.effect: If the rep process of the DR service exits unexpectedly, the DR service on this node becomes unavailable and the cluster reliability deteriorates. If the rep processes on all nodes exit unexpectedly, the DR service is interrupted.

0x100FEA630024.alarm.name: Full Backup Of CCDB Metadata Failed
0x100FEA630024.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether an alarm is generated indicating that the disk space is insufficient.
1.1 If yes, handle the alarm.
1.2 If no=>[Step2].
Step2 Check whether an alarm is generated indicating that the management network is disconnected.
2.1 If yes, handle the alarm.
2.2 If no=>[Step3].
Step3 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.

0x1EA670007.alarm.name: The Negotiated Rate Of The Disk Port Is Inconsistent
0x1EA670007.alarm.advice:
Step1 Check whether the disk is securely inserted.
1.1 If no, reinsert the disk. If the alarm persists=>[Step2].
1.2 If yes=>[Step2].
Step2 Replace the disk. If the alarm persists=>[Step3].
Step3 Collect related information and contact technical support engineers.
